html: Zion’s socio-economic system replaces Babylon’s in the millennial age (Isaiah 30:23-24; 32:15-20). In the absence of transgression, only the results of righteousness appear—peace, productivity, fertility, and longevity. Instead of the iniquities of the parents passing down to their children (Exodus 34:7; Deuteronomy 5:9), only their blessings pass down. When his people petition him, Jehovah instantly answers: “O people of Zion, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, you shall have no cause to weep. He will graciously respond at the cry of your voice; he will answer you as soon as he hears it” (Isaiah 30:19).
